title: Police department misconduct allegations and disciplinary proceedings

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Police department misconduct allegations and disciplinary proceedings
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All materials and records describing and sufficient to show/disclose all allegations of misconduct made and all disciplinary proceedings taken against any officer, employee, or representative of this policing agency. 

As described in the New York Freedom of Information Law, a record is "any information kept, held, filed, produced or reproduced by, with or for an agency or the state legislature, in any physical form whatsoever including, but not limited to, reports, statements, examinations, memoranda, opinions, folders, files, books, manuals, pamphlets, forms, papers, designs, drawings, maps, photos, letters, microfilms, computer tapes or discs, rules, regulations or codes." Records kept in a digital or electronic form are also records, would be responsive to this request, and should be provided. 

These records are typically required to be retained under the New York State Records Retention and Disposition Schedule MU-1 (http://www.archives.nysed.gov/records/retention_mu-1), including, but not limited to, item no. 365, which includes: "Investigative records and disciplinary proceedings, including but not limited to statement of charge, transcript of hearing, notice of decision, letter of termination or resignation, letter of reinstatement, record of appeal procedure, and correspondence." While materials under that schedule have a set retention of 3 years after the final decision rendered, this request and materials responsive to it include *all* records held in the possession of any office or individual employed or formerly employed by this policing agency, including those kept off-site, in digital form, and in personnel files. 

Please note that any failure to provide all potentially-responsive materials and/or the destruction of materials potentially responsive to this request would be a violation of the spirit of the New York Freedom of Information Law, as well as unlawful under the New York FOIL and the terms of the attached litigation hold notice.

Materials responsive to this request include — but are not limited to — all complaints, reports, records of discipline and penalties, aggregate collections of complaint and disciplinary materials (spreadsheets, databases), investigatory materials, relevant related correspondence, photographs, video, other related evidence, proof of discipline or fulfillment of penalties, and all personnel materials (including those used in promotion, contract, and other employment negotiations and considerations) that reference or utilize misconduct allegations or disciplinary materials of any sort.

Materials responsive to this request include all complaints— internal, external, and civilian — and include records disclosing the names, badge numbers, and personnel identification of each officer involved and/or serving as a witness, as well as all available details of the incident/complaint: date, time, location, nature of the incident, description of the incident, nature of the investigation, investigatory materials, the disposition of the case, and any subsequent materials related to the execution of any resultant discipline. Responsive materials include all complaints and allegations against any officer, employee, or representative of this policing agency, regardless of whether that complaint or allegation resulted in any investigation or disciplinary action. 

Responsive materials also include all records of use of force by officers, including records disclosing the names, badge numbers, and personnel identification of each officer involved and/or serving as a witness, as well as all available details of the incident: date, time, location, nature of the incident, description of the incident, nature of the use of force, subsequent investigatory materials related to the use of force, the disposition of any investigation into the incident, and any subsequent materials related to the use of force. 

Please provide materials on a rolling basis, beginning with materials created during the following timeframes: 
• January 1, 2010 - June 15, 2020
• January 1, 2000 - January 1, 2010
• January 1, 1990 - January 1, 2000
• January 1, 1980 - January 1, 1990
• January 1, 1970 - January 1, 1980

Pursuant to NYCRR Section 1401.5(c)(1), should any of this request be unclear or lack sufficient description for your office, please provide direction that would enable this requester to request records reasonably described. Please also note that the New York FOIL states: "An agency shall not deny a request on the basis that the request is voluminous or that locating or reviewing the requested records or providing the requested copies is burdensome because the agency lacks sufficient staffing or on any other basis if the agency may engage an outside professional service to provide copying, programming or other services required to provide the copy...." Please also see FOIL AO 19671, an Advisory Opinion from the Committee on Open Government [https://docs.dos.ny.gov/coog/ftext/f19671.htm]. 

If your office has questions about this request or would like to discuss it for any reason, please contact this requester via the contact email address provided and feel free to follow up by phone: 617-299-1832. This request is being submitted to each policing agency in New York as part of a collaborative project led by MuckRock and involving multiple other educational and journalistic partners and participants. For this reason, over the lifetime of this request, your agency may interface with individuals not listed on this initial communication. 

This request is being made in the public interest by a news organization as part of non-profit (not commercial) journalistic work and research on behalf of the public. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request and as part of the necessary negotiations for successful processing. As far as it is possible, please fulfill elements of this request electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.

I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Beryl Lipton

communications.subject: Link expired
communications.communication:
In reference to the FOIL request for police disciplinary files/use of force files, I have tried to use the link that was sent to us in the past to download documents, but it states that it has expired.  Subsequent links that have been sent to the main WPD email account seemed to immediately expire.  Can you please send me a link directly to my email below?

Thank you,
C. Donoghue

Charles P. Donoghue
Chief of Police
Watertown Police Department
751 Waterman Drive
Watertown, NY 13601
(315) 786-2610
cdonoghue@watertown-ny.gov<mailto:cdonoghue@watertown-ny.gov>

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Police department misconduct allegations and disciplinary proceedings
communications.communication:
Hello, Chief Donoghue —

Thanks so much for your message. Could you please let me know if you have trouble with the link attached to this message?

I really appreciate your help. 

Best wishes,
Beryl

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Police department misconduct allegations and disciplinary proceedings
communications.communication:
Beryl,

The link sent me to a page that stated, “Your login token has expired. You may send a new one now to CDonoghue@watertown-ny.gov<mailto:CDonoghue@watertown-ny.gov>.”  I pressed the button that is labeled “Resend token,” and it sent me another email with the same link.  That link also sent me to the same page with a resend link button and the same message.  I can send documents via regular email if that is easier than trying to figure out the link issue.  If so, let me know what email to send the documents to.

Thanks,
C. Donoghue

Charles P. Donoghue
Chief of Police
Watertown Police Department
751 Waterman Drive
Watertown, NY 13601
(315) 786-2610
cdonoghue@watertown-ny.gov<mailto:cdonoghue@watertown-ny.gov>

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Police department misconduct allegations and disciplinary proceedings
communications.communication:
Hello, Chief Donoghue —

I apologize for having missed your earlier message. I wonder if the upload link is now working? If not, regular email or via Google Drive would be fine.

Thanks so much for your patience and help. I really appreciate it.

Best wishes,
Beryl

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Police department misconduct allegations and disciplinary proceedings
communications.communication:
Beryl,

Please see the attached “Use of Force” documents for the year 2020.  The link is still not working.  More to follow.  I will be out of town for a few days but will try to send additional this Friday (11/05/21).

Thanks,

Charles P. Donoghue
Chief of Police
Watertown Police Department
751 Waterman Drive
Watertown, NY 13601
(315) 786-2610
cdonoghue@watertown-ny.gov<mailto:cdonoghue@watertown-ny.gov>

title: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (Northern Michigan University)

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (Northern Michigan University)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { Michigan Freedom of Information Act. }, I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 5 days }.

Sincerely,

{ Kayla Henson }

title: RICHLAND SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2021) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2021

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: RICHLAND SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2021) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2021
communications.communication:
RICHLAND SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2021) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2021

Via email: galt.pettett@rsd.edu

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

1.	I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by your agency in the year 2021 and a complete electronic copy of your agency's Responses to each of these Public Records Requests for the year 2021.

Note: Parents and students seeking GRADES and/or TRANSCRIPTS in the year 2021 can be excluded from this request.

PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link.

Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service.

 RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.
 
"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Unless the records exist IN PAPER FORM ONLY, DO NOT instead create new records by printing native stored electronic files, then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints only to reproduce them in again in electronic production.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION - FAMILY EDUCATIONAL RIGHTS AND PRIVACY ACT (FERPA)

Take caution with the broad application of redaction and withholding of identified public records claiming "global FERPA" exemptions. When an agency claims an exemption for an entire record or portion of one, it must inform the requestor of the statutory exemption and provide a brief explanation of how the exemption applies to the record or portion withheld. RCW 42.17.310(4)/42.56.210(3). The brief explanation should cite the statute the agency claims grant an exemption from disclosure. The brief explanation should provide enough information for a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the claimed exemption is proper. Global, nonspecific claims of exemption such as "FERPA" are insufficient. One way to properly provide a brief explanation of the withheld record or redaction is for the agency to provide a withholding index. It identifies the type of record, its date and number of pages, and the author or recipient of the record (unless their identity is exempt). The withholding index should allow a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the agency has properly invoked the exemption. There are several exceptions to the FERPA exemption and any agency silently withholding large swaths of public records citing "FERPA!" without providing the original identified record, properly redacted, or if withheld in its entirety, providing a record description and page count or record length, will be challenged in accordance with RCW 42.56.550 if a reasonably detailed withholding index or exemption log is not included.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: R000186-010623
communications.communication:
Dear 137725-08923247 MuckRock 2021 Public Records Requests: 
Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 12/13/2022 and given the reference number R000186-010623 for tracking purposes. 
 Records Requested: I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by your agency in the year 2021 and a complete electronic copy of your agency's Responses to each of these Public Records Requests for the year 2021. 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate all responsive records and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted within five business days about the availability and/or provided with copies of responsive records or provided with an estimate of time it will take the District to answer your request. 
Please note that the Washington State Public Records Act does not require the District to create new records, to conduct legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. 
 
Richland School District

communications.subject: [Records Center] Public Records Request :: R000186-010623
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

 RE: Public Records Request of December 13, 2022, Reference # R000186-010623 Dear 137725-08923247 MuckRock 2021 Public Records Requests, The Richland School District received a public records request from you on December 13, 2022. You requested the following records: I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by your agency in the year 2021 and a complete electronic copy of your agency's Responses to each of these Public Records Requests for the year 2021. On behalf of the District and the Records Department, I want to apologize for the delay in acknowledging your request and the delay in getting you your first installment of responsive records.  As stated, the District received your request on Tuesday, December 13th. The students and most employees in the District began their winter break on the afternoon of Friday, December 16th. The District's administration building was open for business on the following week but was closed from December 26th until January 3 rd. Not to make excuses but the only thing I can figure is that your request got mixed in with others the District is currently working to answer for copies of public records requests the District received in 2019 and 2020.  Again I apologize for the delay and confusion. The District understands that you do not wish the District to use the GovQA platform when answering your request. The District will be sending responsive records to the e-mail address provided but it will also be utilizing the GovQA platform so that it can track all of its records request related correspondence. Attached please find the first installment of responsive records to your request. You can expect the next installment in the next twelve working days. As you may know, while the public records laws in Washington State are very broad and presume disclosure, they do not require a public agency to create a record to answer a request.  Therefore, if the District has records that answer your request, it will provide them to you as requested. Beginning December 1, 2022 the District will be charging for all public records requests.  Please see our policy and procedures for our fee schedule https://app.eduportal.com/documents/view/820578  and  https://app.eduportal.com/documents/view/820577 If you have any questions or if i have misunderstood your request in any way, please let me know by responding to this email. Sincerely, Galt Pettett Certified Records Officer 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Public Records Request Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1Har4pEM4U1SR66a9o2fNaoRxQVaj8HzobKcSJOs3LSpRri-2Fuw4R3b1PIgmRHl-2FsqahSuFu9wFQQNyCeKaFIeNzE8euPGc99Z44vtngxku-2B5-2FaVf9_JdFAmLAMOxO1VxGbNuowsToBu824cZaGSJFMeEsdzs-2BC-2F1gbrMk1IZw3g8yBnL8KiDbfVKF5upUsRsrAzPAIa9vNfqleUXeRNEJFV-2Bci76iDsyMGms8qsZCS-2F965-2BP8DVH6H2ArRGXXo02cJ19uut8xb0WKrf5HD5XeRzPMd3b3Bky28JBmV1efDw3DyzYLjqi5xRAuiQt1ktHQohK2SYVzmPCRaDFsj7DeNxjEpXhI-3D)

communications.subject: R000186-010623 Installment
communications.communication:
RE: Public Records Request of December 13, 2022, Reference # R000186-010623

Dear 137725-08923247 MuckRock 2021 Public Records Requests,

Richland School District received a public records request from you on December 13, 2022. You requested the following records:

I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by your agency in the year 2021 and a complete electronic copy of your agency's Responses to each of these Public Records Requests for the year 2021.

Richland School District has identified and located records responsive to your request.  An installment to your public records request is now available. The District understands that you do not wish the District to use the GovQA platform when answering your request. The District will be sending responsive records to the e-mail address provided but it will also be utilizing the GovQA platform so that it can track all of its records request related correspondence. Attached please find an installment of responsive records to your request. You can expect the next installment in the next twelve working days. As you may know, while the public records laws in Washington State are very broad and presume disclosure, they do not require a public agency to create a record to answer a request.  Therefore, if the District has records that answer your request, it will provide them to you as requested. Please log in to the Public Records Request Center at the following link to retrieve the responsive records.

The District acknowledges your request to "provide all identified public records in their NATIVE format." Some information in identified public records require redaction. The District's redaction software requires all attachments to be in PDF format. Therefore, any document requiring redaction will be in PDF format, which may or may not be native format. All redactions will be listed on a redaction log. Also, some attachments not requiring redaction have been converted to PDF to reduce file size as you have requested the District to "provide all records electronically via direct email attachment...".

If you prefer to receive documents in native format, it will increase the Districts response time and could incur additional fees.

Public Records Request - R000186-010623<https://rsdwa.govqa.us/WEBAPP/_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=344&coid=7BFE0C48206CDD>

Beginning December 1, 2022 the District will be charging for all public records requests.  Please see our policy and procedures for our fee schedule https://app.eduportal.com/documents/view/820578  and  https://app.eduportal.com/documents/view/820577

If I have misunderstood your request in any way or you have any questions, please reply to this email.

Sincerely,

Kelsey Greenough
Legal


Kelsey Greenough
Records Specialist

All redactions will be listed on a redaction log. Also, some attachments not requiring redaction have been converted to PDF to reduce file size as you have requested the District to "provide all records electronically via direct email attachment...".

If you prefer to receive documents in native format, it will increase the Districts response time and could incur additional fees.

Please log in to the Public Records Request Center at the following link to retrieve the responsive records.

Dear 137725-08923247 MuckRock 2021 Public Records Requests,

Richland School District received a public records request from you on December 13, 2022. You requested the following records:

I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by your agency in the year 2021 and a complete electronic copy of your agency's Responses to each of these Public Records Requests for the year 2021.

Richland School District has identified and located records responsive to your request.  An installment to your public records request is now available. The District understands that you do not wish the District to use the GovQA platform when answering your request. The District will be sending responsive records to the e-mail address provided but it will also be utilizing the GovQA platform so that it can track all of its records request related correspondence. Attached please find an installment of responsive records to your request. You can expect the next installment in the next three working days. As you may know, while the public records laws in Washington State are very broad and presume disclosure, they do not require a public agency to create a record to answer a request.  Therefore, if the District has records that answer your request, it will provide them to you as requested. Please log in to the Public Records Request Center at the following link to retrieve the responsive records.

The District acknowledges your request to "provide all identified public records in their NATIVE format." Some information in identified public records require redaction. title: IPA mobility program agreements

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: IPA mobility program agreements
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) All requests for certification as an eligible organization under the Intergovernmental Personnel Act mobility program submitted to your agency since Jan. 1, 2017. Organizations wishing to participate in the mobility program must first submit request for certification packets to the agency with which they seek to partner. Detailed descriptions of the IPA Mobility Program, its rules and regulations, and the documentation participating agencies must maintain can be found here: https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/hiring-information/intergovernment-personnel-act/#url=Provisions.

2) A list, roster, database, or comparable record documenting all of the organizations currently approved by your agency to participate in the IPA mobility program. If a list, roster, database, or similar record containing responsive information is not available, I ask that you provide your agency's approval letter for each organization.

 3) A list, roster, database, or comparable record documenting all of the IPA mobility program assignments approved by your agency since Jan. 1, 2020. If a list, roster, database, or similar record containing responsive information is not available, I ask that you provide assignment agreement documents for each assignment. Please note: I understand and accept that some information—namely, SSN, address, DOB—would have to be redacted from the assignment agreements. It is for this reason that I've requested the records in formats that are easy to filter or redact. 

I request expedited processing of this request under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E)(v)(II). I am a working journalist and I intend to use the requested records to "[engage] in disseminating information ... to inform the public concerning actual or alleged Federal Government activity."

I also ask that all fees be waived as I intend to use the requested records to publish articles in the public interest and not for any commercial purpose. In the event you choose to impose fees, I request a detailed breakdown of the fees, including the hourly wage of each employee involved and an explanation justifying the employee hours required to fulfill the request.

Should you choose to reject this request or redact portions of it, I ask that you provide a detailed explanation and citations to the statutory exemptions and associated case law underlying your decision to withhold each/any portions from public review.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Todd Feathers

communications.subject: Request Acknowledgement by DOL FOIA

Dear Todd Feathers, 

Your request has been received by the DOL FOIA. The request has been assigned the tracking # 2022-F-12115, please log into your account and review your submission. 

The application address is https://efoia.dol.gov. 

Thank you, 
DOL FOIA

communications.subject: Acknowledgment
communications.communication:
"August 3, 2022

 

Todd Feathers
MuckRock News
DEPT MR 132317
263 Huntington Avenue
Boston, MA 02115

 

Todd:

 

This acknowledges receipt of your FOIA request to OSHA for records related to their involvement in the Intergovernmental Personnel Act (IPA) mobility program. Since these type records are maintained by our Office of the Assistant Secretary for Administration and Management (OASAM), your request has been assigned to them with tracking number 2022-F-12115. You may use this number to track the progress of your request at https://efoia.dol.gov/app/CheckStatus.aspx. If you need to contact the agency about it for any reason, please submit your inquiry through March.Candy.A@dol.gov or phone 202-693-7286. In addition, it would be helpful to include the tracking number in the Subject line of any submission to them or to have it available at the time of a call.
















































Sincerely,

 































Darlene Miller | Government Information Specialist, Office of Information Services

Division of Management and Administrative Legal Services (MALS) | Office of the Solicitor

U S Department of Labor | 200 Constitution Avenue NW N2420 | Washington DC 20210

Phone:  202-693-5442 | Fax:  202-693-5389 | Email: miller.darlene@dol.gov | e-FOIAs: foiarequests@dol.gov"

communications.subject: FOIA Seeking IPA Documents
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

This email is in response to your FOIA in which you requested records pertaining to the Intergovernmental Personnel Act. Specifically, you requested copies of "all requests for certification as an eligible organization under the Intergovernmental Personnel Act mobility program submitted to your agency since Jan. 1, 2017, a list of all organizations currently approved, and a list of all assignments approved since January 1, 2020." The Office of Human Resources with OASAM maintains the IPA program and as such was assigned your request.

Attached, you will find a copy of all requested IPA records that are pertaining to the program. Included is a copy of all assignment agreements, lists from both DOL and OPM providing names of approved organzations and the supporting documents provided to the Department of Labor by the organizations. The individual agreements have been redacted under FOIA Exemption 6 (5 U.S.C. § 552(b)(6)), which protects information about individuals in  "personnel and medical files and similar files" when the disclosure of such information "would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy."

Please let me know if you have any questions or difficulties with the attached documents. While we have been as responsive as possible to your request, if you feel we have responded in error, you may file an appeal with the Solicitor of Labor within 90 days from the date of this letter.  The appeal must state the grounds for the appeal and must include supporting statements, arguments, a copy of your initial request, and a copy of this letter.  To facilitate processing, you may fax your appeal to (202) 693-5538.  If mailed, please clearly mark the envelope and the letter of appeal:  "Freedom of Information Act Appeal," and address to:  Solicitor of Labor, U. S.  Department of Labor, 200 Constitution Avenue, NW, Room N-2428, Washington, D.C.  20210.

Thank you,

Danielle




Danielle Magrath
[cid:image001.png@01D8C1EA.D062BEF0]
Office of the Assistant Secretary for Administration and Management
U.S. Department of Labor | www.dol.gov<http://www.dol.gov/> | gonzales-magrath.danielle@dol.gov<mailto:gonzales-magrath.danielle@dol.gov>
200 Constitution Avenue, N.W. Suite C5517
Washington, D.C.  20210
202.693.7721 (Office - Eastern Standard Time)
703.956.0291 (Home/Telework - Mountain Standard Time)

title: Pennsylvania Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pennsylvania Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (Indiana University)

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Pennsylvania Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pennsylvania Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (Indiana University)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { Pennsylvania Freedom of Information Act. }, I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 5 days }.

Sincerely,

{ Kayla Henson }

communications.subject: RE: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (Delta College)
communications.communication:
January 31, 2023



Dear Kayla -

Please be advised that Delta College received your electronic FOIA request dated, Tuesday, January 24, 2023, on Wednesday, January 25, in which you requested the following:

"-A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.

- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.

- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation."


Your request is granted.


Pursuant to MCL 15.234, this request took less than 15 minutes to fulfill, therefore there is no charge related to the granting of this FOIA request. Please find the requested information attached to this email.



You may obtain a copy of the Delta College FOIA Procedures and Guidelines and the Delta College Public Summary of FOIA Procedures and Guidelines on Delta College's website http://www.delta.edu/transparency/freedom-of-information-act.html<https://nam11.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.delta.edu%2Ftransparency%2Ffreedom-of-information-act.html&data=04%7C01%7CKayla.Sewell%40lexisnexisrisk.com%7C4fdc9a1504b74163136608d9f0020e3a%7C9274ee3f94254109a27f9fb15c10675d%7C0%7C0%7C637804714069956981%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=lnHwTFd2cu8b86fdb7VGPPyuuVuSliNi1FeodG0zK9Y%3D&reserved=0>.



Thanks,



Andrea



Andrea Ursuy
Executive Director of Administrative Services and Institutional Effectiveness
FOIA Coordinator
Delta College<https://www.delta.edu/> | 989-686-9222 | 989-667-2224 - fax
B141 | 1961 Delta Road, University Center, MI 48710

title: Five Points RRU Reviews

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Five Points RRU Reviews
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All reports from 60-day residential rehabilitation unit (RRU) "reviews" -- as mandated in subparagraph iii of paragraph m of subdivision 6 of section 137 of the state correction law -- from the Five Points Correctional Facility that were completed between May 30, 2022, and the present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Gelardi

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: California Freedom of Information Act. Request: California Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (California State University, Chico)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kayla Henson

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: California Freedom of Information Act. Request: California Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (California State University, Chico)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following California Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Jan. 23, 2023. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

Ms. Henson,
We received your Public Records Act request email for the following records on 1/23/2023:
- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.
We have conducted a reasonable search for these records under California Government Code §6253 and have determined that your request either in whole or in part, seeks copies of disclosable public records. We retrieved twenty two (22) pages responsive to your request. As the records previously existed in digital format, there is no charge. Per your request, we uploaded the records via the link  you provided.  
Sincerely,
Mike

Mike Thorpe
Executive Director
Risk Management | Environmental Health & Safety| Property Management
400 West First Street | Chico | 95929-0130
Work phone: 530-898-5566

communications.subject: PRA 23-15: Contract with Pepsi or Coca-Cola
communications.communication:
Dear Kayla Henson:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I am responding to your
request for a copy of any and all contracts (including associated
amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision
thereof, as outlined in your email dated January 23, 2023.

The activity and related records for your request are administered by the
California State University, Fresno Association, Inc. (Association), an
auxiliary organization that is a separate entity from the University and
runs in accordance with California Education Code Sections 89900, et seq.,
and Title V of the California Code of Regulations, Sections 42400, et seq.
As such, this response is also sent on behalf of the Association pursuant
to the Richard McKee Transparency Act of 2011.

The Association conducted a reasonable search for records under California
Government Code §6253 and Education Code §89914.5 and determined that your
request either in whole or in part, seeks copies of disclosable public
records.

The CSU standard duplication rate has been established at 20 cents per page
irrespective of whether records are produced in hard or electronic format.
In this instance, there is no charge as there was no need to convert/copy
the documents to a PDF in response to your request. The records were
already in that format and are attached to this email.

If you have any questions, I can be reached via email or by phone at
559.278.7461.

Sincerely,

Esther
Esther Gonzalez
Office of the Vice President for Administration
California State University, Fresno
Phone: 559.278.7461 <(559)%20278-7461>

title: Sustained findings since 2017

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Sustained findings since 2017
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Under the Massachusetts Public Records Act § 66-10 et seq., I am requesting copies of records related to cases of sustained findings of police misconduct at the Internal Affairs Unit of the Brockton Police, between 2017 and 2022. This includes, but is not limited to, documents, reports, multimedia, body-worn camera footage, arrest filings, and so on. It also includes all documents, notes, correspondence and memoranda evidencing sustained findings reports and investigations, and all communication and correspondence in whatever tangible medium between the officials, the victims and the overseeing agency. 

I am requesting digital copies of all responsive documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. 

Here, misconduct includes, but is not limited to:

Excessive (unreasonable) force – beatings, manhandling of people in handcuffs, improper use of Tasers, injuries inflicted by police dogs, improper use of deadly force, and other police brutality or disregard for the safety of suspects. It also includes, but is not limited to: physical and verbal abuse, restraints happening unreasonably, coerced or forced confessions, and sexual abuse and assault. 

False arrests – pulling over, detention, questioning and searches conducted without any probable cause whatsoever, including cases of planted evidence, racial profiling and trumped-up charges of resisting arrest.

Misconduct investigations do not fall under records that are exempted by the law: “personnel and medical files or information and any other materials or data relating to a specifically named individual, the disclosure of which may constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy; provided, however, that this subclause shall not apply to records related to a law enforcement misconduct investigation”. 

The Massachusetts Public Records Act requires a response to this request within 10 days.  If access to the records I am requesting will take longer than this amount of time, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

Should you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me at 415-769-8210 or ananyatiwarijournalism@gmail.com.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ananya Tiwari

communications.communication:
Good Afternoon:

Please be advised that your November 14, 2022 request for records was
answered fully and responsive documents were in fact forwarded to you by
Brockton Police Records Access personnel on November 22, 2023.  A copy of
that response is attached hereto.

That request having been responded to completely as indicated in the
attached records, and where today's request is a duplicate of the November
14, 2022 Request, the City considers that duplicate request as having been
fulfilled and closed on this date.

If you care to discuss this request and response in greater detail, feel
free to send me an e-mail or give me a call at the number provided on this
e-mail message.  Thank you.

*Very truly,*


*Anthony J. Donegan, Jr.*
*Assistant City Solicitor*
*City of Brockton Law Department*
*45 School Street, 1st Floor*
*Brockton, MA  02301*
*Tel. (508) 580-7110*
*He/Him/His*

intended solely for the use of the individual or entity to whom they are
addressed. If you have received this email in error, please delete the
email from your system and notify the sender immediately. This message
contains confidential information and is intended only for the individual
named. If you are not the named addressee, you should not disseminate,
distribute or copy this email. If you are not the intended recipient, you
are notified that disclosing, copying, distributing or taking any action in
reliance on the contents of this information is strictly prohibited.

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (Central Michigan University)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { Michigan Freedom of Information Act. }, I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 5 days }.

Sincerely,

{ Kayla Henson }

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (Central Michigan University)
communications.communication:
Dear Requestor,

Central Michigan University is in receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). You asked for
the following records: “Any and all contracts awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof for the provision of beverages and other goods. As well as if contracts were canceled any and all materials related to the cancellation and statements from the university regarding the cancellation”

The purpose of this email is to notify you that CMU is obtaining an extension pursuant to MCL 15.235 (2)(d). You will receive a response to your request by February 14, 2023. The purpose of the extension is to gather and review potentially responsive records.


In accordance with the Michigan FOIA, I am providing you with a summary of CMU’s procedures and guidelines for processing FOIA requests, available here: FOIA Summary <https://www.cmich.edu/docs/default-source/president's-division/general-counsel/freedom-of-information-act-processing-summary-procedures-and-guidelines-2022.01.109373a08e-5999-4c4e-a2bd-bdc424a60be2.pdf?Status=Master&sfvrsn=58441697_3/&v=1>

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.

- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.

- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kayla Henson

  *   A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
  *   If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act and based on your response, we will respond within five business days of the receipt of your request. We will provide responsive documentation on or before January 31, 2023.

communications.subject: RE: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (Joliet Junior College)
communications.communication:
Thank you for writing to Joliet Junior College with your Freedom of Information Act request pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. On  January 24, 2023, you made a request for the following information:



  *   A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
  *   If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
  *   If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

Your request is granted with redactions. Please find the attached documentation responsive to your request. Certain redactions have been made pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7 (1)(g). 

According to this statute, the following information is exempt from disclosure: "Trade secrets and commercial or financial information obtained from a person or business where the trade secrets or commercial or financial information are furnished under a claim they are proprietary, privileged or confidential and that disclosure of such would cause competitive harm to the business." We were given permission from the agency to provide you with this information even though there is a confidentiality provision, with pricing and financial information redacted under this exemption.

You have the right to have your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General, 5 ILCS 140/9.5 (a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to:

Public Access Counselor
Office of the Attorney General
500 South 2nd Street
Springfield, IL 62706
Fax: 217-782-1396
Email: Publicaccess@atg.state.il.us

You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court, 5 ILCS 140/11.

If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this response, 5 ILCS 140/9.5 (a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request with this letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC.

Kind Regards,



Tracy Morris, Ed.D.
Compliance Officer
Joliet Junior College
D1004A
815-280-2704
(she, her, hers)
Certified Compliance and Ethics Professional (CCEP) ®

title: Police Staff Roster (January 2023) (Renton Police Department)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police Staff Roster (January 2023) (Renton Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.communication:
Good Afternoon,

Kennesaw State University’s Division of Legal Affairs is in receipt of your below Open Records Act request. Your original request was filtered into our spam inbox, so thank you for following up.

I have attached KSU’s Campus-Wide Sponsorship Agreement with The Coca-Cola Company. I anticipate that I will be able to provide additional responsive documents, if any, by the close of business on Friday, February 3rd. Pursuant to applicable law, if the cost associated with searching for, retrieving, and compiling such records will exceed $25, I will advise you of that estimated cost prior to conducting the search. There is no cost associated with the provision of this initial document because it took less than 15 minutes to retrieve.

Please advise if you have any questions or difficulty accessing the document, otherwise I will provide additional documents or notify you that there are no other responsive documents on or before this Friday.
Thanks,

[Kennesaw State University]

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act.  I hereby request former FDA employee Scott Gottlieb's emails containing the following case-insensitive keywords: 

genetic; genetically; modified; engineered; phthalates; bentgrass; AquAdvantage; salmon; labeling; natural; antibiotic; antibiotics; rBGH; bovine; growth; hormone; hormones; rBST; pesticide; pesticides; glyphosate; neonicotinoid; neonicotinoids; Monsanto; Roundup; Bayer; Dow; DuPont; Syngenta; and ChemChina.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Request #2017-3215
communications.communication:
Dear Director Kotler,

Thank you for discussing my request with me over the phone today. According to our conversation, it is my understanding that the only email records pertaining to Scott Gottlieb that were maintained by the FDA were emails to or from broad distribution lists. As I am concerned more with direct correspondence with Mr. Gottlieb's professional email address, you may exclude those broad distribution emails from this request. If there is a way for Information Management and Technology to retrieve deleted emails during that time frame, I would appreciate it for Mr. Gottlieb's email account.

I am also aware that official correspondence that went through the Office of the Commissioner was archived starting in 2005. Please amend my request to include these records that were sent from or to or referenced Scott Gottlieb.

Thank you,

Alexander Rony
Sierra Club

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Request #2017-3215
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Rony,

The only records we can recover from Mr. Gottlieb were the ones I described to you during our call. Therefore, with respect to your current request, we have no responsive records (appeal rights below). We will log your email below as a request for any official OC correspondence.

You have the right to appeal this determination.   By filing an appeal, you preserve your rights under FOIA and give the agency a chance to review and reconsider your request and the agency's decision.

Your appeal must be mailed within 90 days from the date of this response, to:


Ms. Catherine Teti

Deputy Agency Chief FOIA Officer

U.S. Department of Health and Human Services

Office of the Assistant Secretary for Public Affairs

Room 729H

200 Independence Avenue, S.W.

Washington, DC 20201

Please clearly mark both the envelope and your letter "Freedom of Information Act Appeal."

If you would like to discuss our response before filing an appeal to attempt to resolve your dispute without going through the appeals process, please contact me at 301-796-8976 or Sarah.Kotler@fda.hhs.gov. You may also contact the FDA FOIA Public Liaison for assistance at:


Office of the Executive Secretariat

US Food & Drug Administration

5630 Fishers Lane, Room 1050

Rockville, MD 20857



E-mail: FDAFOIA@fda.hhs.gov<mailto:FDAFOIA@fda.hhs.gov>


If you are unable to resolve your FOIA dispute through our FOIA Public Liaison, the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS), the Federal FOIA Ombudsman's office, offers mediation services to help resolve disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies. The contact information for OGIS is:


Office of Government Information Services
National Archives and Records Administration
8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS
College Park, MD 20740-6001

Telephone:  202-741-5770

Toll-Free: 1-877-684-6448

E-mail: ogis@nara.gov<mailto:ogis@nara.gov>

Fax: 202-741-5769

Sincerely,



Sarah B. Kotler, J.D.
Director
Office of the Executive Secretariat
Division of Freedom of Information
U.S. Food and Drug Administration
Tel: 301-796-8976
Sarah.Kotler@fda.hhs.gov<mailto:Sarah.Kotler@fda.hhs.gov>

files.source: Food and Drug Administration

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Request #2017-3853
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Marquis and Ms. Taylor,

Thank you for your May 9 acknowledgment letter of my FOIA request (number 2017-00731-FOIA-OS). In it, you stated, "If your request seeks a waiver or reduction of the fees that we would customarily charge for furnishing agency records and your request does not contain sufficient information to enable us to determine whether a waiver or reduction of fees is warranted, you should provide such information to this office within 10 working days of receipt of this letter.

I respectfully request that you waive all fees in connection with this request as provided by 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii). The Sierra Club is a national environmental nonprofit with no commercial interest in obtaining the requested information. Instead, our organization intends to analyze and disseminate the requested information free of charge so that the public can be better informed and meaningfully participate in the proper oversight of food and drugs.

The subject matter of the requested records is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations and activities of the government by disclosing the views of the new head of the Food and Drug Administration on certain topics that are expected to come before the government.

The Sierra Club and its supporters have demonstrated interest and expertise in the subject area, specifically the development of policies designed to safeguard public health, reduce the amount of toxic chemicals in food, and encourage a sustainable agricultural economy. Our supporters have filed hundreds of thousands of public comments to agencies related to these issues.

The Sierra Club also has the ability and intention to disseminate the information it receives through this request. The information may be shared through emails to an audience of hundreds of thousands of people, Facebook and Twitter posts reaching thousands of individuals, articles on our website, and analysis provided to the media. 

In addition to being granted a public interest fee waiver, I ask that I be properly categorized as a media use requester. My professional duties at the Sierra Club include composing mass communications to our followers, analyzing FOIA responses, and coordinating with press secretaries. Here are three such examples that resulted from my work:

https://sierraclub.org/planet/2017/04/hiring-freeze-prevented-epa-filling-hundreds-jobs 
http://www.cnn.com/2017/04/13/politics/epa-hiring-freeze/index.html 
http://www.centerforfoodsafety.org/press-releases/4480/over-700000-people-tell-government-to-block-seed-mergers 

I hope this is enough information for you to grant me a public interest fee waiver and media requester status, but please let me know if you need more details.

Sincerely,

Alexander Rony
Sierra Club

title: Card Checks April 2022-November 2022

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Card Checks April 2022-November 2022
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records sufficient to show following information about card checks services performed by the FMCS

* employer name
* employer location
* proposed bargaining representative
* size of the unit
* count of the cards
* date of the card check
* outcome of the card check

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Forest Gregg

title: Alaska DOC Adult Pay to Stay Policy

communications.subject: Alaska Public Records Act Request: Alaska DOC Adult Pay to Stay Policy
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alaska Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The following materials regarding the imposition, assessment, collection and balances of inmate fees and debt:

a) All current policies and procedures regarding medical and room & board costs or fees for which inmates are or may become liable. Please include all policies and procedures related to how fees are set, accrued, imposed, collected, and enforced (such as those related to per diem fees, ability to pay determinations, penalties for late or non-payment, authorization for civil or criminal action for payment enforcement, etc). 

b) All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding debts/restitution paid to or owed to this department or any facility/agency under its jurisdiction in FY2021. Please include all relevant data regarding medical and room & board costs, including the number of individuals charged for medical and room & board costs or fees and the total amount of medical and room & board fees imposed in FY2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mercy Loyo

communications.subject: RE: Alaska Public Records Act Request: Alaska DOC Adult Pay to Stay Policy
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Alaska Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Dec. 15, 2022. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: Alaska DOC public records request
communications.communication:
Good morning,

On December 29, 2022, the Alaska Department of Corrections (DOC) received your public records request (PRR).

You requested the following:
a) All current policies and procedures regarding medical and room & board costs or fees for which inmates are or may become liable. Please include all policies and procedures related to how fees are set, accrued, imposed, collected, and enforced (such as those related to per diem fees, ability to pay determinations, penalties for late or non-payment, authorization for civil or criminal action for payment enforcement, etc).
b) All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding debts/restitution paid to or owed to this department or any facility/agency under its jurisdiction in FY2021. Please include all relevant data regarding medical and room & board costs, including the number of individuals charged for medical and room & board costs or fees and the total amount of medical and room & board fees imposed in FY2021.


As allowed by 2AAC 96.325, I anticipate being able to provide the information you request in ten working days of receipt of your request, on January 13, 2023.


It is important to note there may be a cost associated with public records searches, an estimate of which is based on the parameters of your search. Once you acknowledge you would like to proceed with this request, I can provide you with an estimated cost of the search. Please note that the estimate is for costs associated with searching DOC records and is no guarantee that any responsive records exist. We may not locate any records responsive to your request, and you will still be charged the search fee. If responsive records are located, then those documents allowable for release will be made available to you.

Respectfully,
Betsy

communications.subject: RE: Alaska Public Records Act Request: Alaska DOC Adult Pay to Stay Policy
communications.communication:
This is to advise you that I am extending the basic 10-working-day period for the remainder of your request.  I expect to be able to respond to your request on or before January 27, 2023.  This extension is not invoked for purposes of delay.  The cause for extension is in accordance with 2 AAC 96.325(d)(1) which states the need to search for and collect the requested records from a field office separate from the office responsible for maintaining the records.



I am working diligently to process your request and anticipate that I will be able to provide a response on or before the extended deadline.


Betsy
Betsy Holley
Public Information Officer
Alaska Department of Corrections

communications.subject: Alaska DOC public records response
communications.communication:
January 27, 2023

Mercy Loyo
Via MuckRock News
            Via email: 137954-63610612@requests.muckrock.com<mailto:137954-63610612@requests.muckrock.com>

Mercy,


I am responding to your December 29, 2022 public records request for the following:

a) "All current policies and procedures regarding medical and room & board costs or fees for which inmates are or may become liable. Please include all policies and procedures related to how fees are set, accrued, imposed, collected, and enforced (such as those related to per diem fees, ability to pay determinations, penalties for late or non-payment, authorization for civil or criminal action for payment enforcement, etc).

b) All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding debts/restitution paid to or owed to this department or any facility/agency under its jurisdiction in FY2021. Please include all relevant data regarding medical and room & board costs, including the number of individuals charged for medical and room & board costs or fees and the total amount of medical and room & board fees imposed in FY2021."


Records responsive to your request are provided, as follows:
a) Our complete Policies and Procedures are available in the public domain and as such, we are not required to provide them (2 AAC 96.100 (b))
b) a responsive spreadsheet it attached.


Respectfully,
Betsy
